âœ¨ é‡‘å¥

  • â€œSubstack is just blogging with a business model. And I was like, that sounds pretty good.â€
  • â€œThe core of Substack is this idea of independence, this idea that the individual left to like do the thing they believe, say the thing they believe, make the thing they believe, supported by an audience thatâ€™s there for them is this like crucial ingredient in a healthy culture, in a free society.â€
  • â€œWhat if the future of media isnâ€™t controlled by algorithms or legacy institutions, but by independent voices building directly with their audiences?â€
  • â€œThe media you consume is not just how you spend your time, itâ€™s who you become.â€
  • â€œI aspire that the Substack app can be a place where you look back at the time you spend on it and think, damn, Iâ€™m glad I did that. That made me a better person.â€
  • â€œThere's no scarcity of content, but there's a huge scarcity of good content. There's a huge scarcity of things that are worth paying attention to.â€
